docs.lead_paragraph: It was the first type of antidepressant, and for many people the monamine oxidase, or MAO, inhibitor remains the best hope for relief from major depression. The trouble is that the side effects can be so serious that MAO inhibitors are rarely prescribed. When taken with certain foods, for example, they may bring on sudden and severe hypertension.

headline.main: Patch Raises New Hope For Beating Depression

docs.abstract: Article on study reported in November issue of American Journal of Psychiatry suggesting that administering MAO inhibitor selegiline in patch form gives patients benefits of antidepressant without usual side effects, including sudden and severe hypertension (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: We sit around a large table in the conference room of the First Choice Community Health Center here. A purple paisley sheet, hung with duct tape, covers the window fronting the parking lot. In a corner is a wheeled cart stacked with hospital gowns, gauze pads, syringes and a hydroculator unit, a metal tank containing hot packs in a water bath. There are nine of us, including Magda P., who sits at the head of the table, and all of us are munching grapes and Hershey Kisses from the communal snacks on the table.

headline.main: In Pain Clinic, Fruit, Candy And Relief

docs.abstract: Dr Ben Daitz Doctor's Journal essay describes examination and treatments offered to patients at interdisciplinary chronic pain clinic in Albuquerque, NM; photo (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: INTERNATIONAL A3-9 Iraq's Neighbors Put Conditions on U.S. War Most of Iraq's neighbors seem prepared to support an American military campaign to remove Saddam Hussein from power. However, their backing is not assured and rests on several political and military factors. A1
